title: I just started writing for the first time. How do I keep my motivation and creativity? Are there rules I should know to set the tone and keep the flow? Any advice would be helpful! - Quora

response.answer_text: I just started writing for the first time. How do I keep my motivation and creativity? Are there rules I should know to set the tone and keep the flow? Any advice would be helpful! So, here’s some things. If you don’t already have a writer friend to talk shop or correspond with… that is a MASSIVE help. More so, if you can join a group where they motivate you to be productive. A good group is hard to find… but when you get one it just makes the experience less isolating. I have my Auth-mentors space (Auth-mentors) which I’m hoping to get writers hooked up with groups… there’s also a lot of good writing articles in there too. One secret is DO NOT tell your story idea to anyone. A piece or a part but never the whole idea. Part of the storytelling push is TO TELL THE STORY… if you let it out, so to speak, it reduces your own urgency to get the story written down. Talk freely about story bits you have committed to page— but keep mum about what you haven’t written yet. Set milestones for yourself. Give yourself rewards for hitting them. Make every day productive. If you can’t write, edit or brainstorm, or read about writing craft… as long as your scheduled time is just about writing. Make yourself a reading list of books in your genre. Get inspired. Be creative!

First. What are you writing? Fiction, non-fiction. If its fiction, what genre? If nonfiction, what is your expertise. In either case put your answer in GOOGE and read all you can about your topic. Those articles will recommend books, training closes, and methods. All this should take a few years. In the meantime, write. It doesn’t matter if it’s good. One last thing. If you are doing this for money or notoriety you will likely fail. If you are doing it because you have something in your heart that you must say. NEVER stop.
